channel.title: Java Graphics2D Problem
channel.description:
So I'm trying to learn more about game clients and Java 2D graphics. I wanted to start off by creating a simple 2D world game client that has a basic 4 directional moving sprite in a tiled world. But right at the start I've run into a simpleton problem and cannot figure out where I fucked it up.
I'm having trouble constructing an ImageIcon. From reading a few tutorials it seems to be done like such:
[code=java] ImageIcon spriteImage = new ImageIcon(this.getClass().getResource("./path/to/image/sprite.png")); [/code]
Then constructing a new Image object using spriteImage.getImage().
It is throwing a null pointer exception implying it cannot find the image file, which I can't understand as to why. I've moved it through directories and tried a number of iterations of debugging but cannot figure it out. I was wondering if anyone could give me assistance and bare with my ignorance.
I've attached the small amount of source code that I actually have.
Client [3kb]: http://uppit.com/oio10qksk4rf/client.zip

item.title: Java Graphics2D Problem
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:8, topic:386982”]Thank you greatly everyone, I’ll do some research and if I should be successful in my learning I may show off my improvements.[/quote]I actually think that using a third party library such as Slick2d could be advantageous over doing everything from scratch (assuming you have an idea for a game).

Read full topic

item.title: Java Graphics2D Problem
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:6, topic:386982”]I’d say swing does more work for you than jogl…[/quote]I tend to disagree actually. GL makes a lot of things much more convenient.

item.title: Java Graphics2D Problem
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:4, topic:386982”]So should I use JOGL for the 2D graphics?[/quote]If you are learning, I would start off by creating your own “engine”. Get to know how shit works before you start having things do most of the work for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Graphics2D Problem
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

So should I use JOGL for the 2D graphics?

Read full topic

item.title: Java Graphics2D Problem
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Haven’t checked as i cbf but one thing: Do not use fukken Swing/AWT components for it (except for canvas/frame).

overload the paint(Graphics g) method and use the functions in Graphics class to your disposal.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Graphics2D Problem
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

So I’m trying to learn more about game clients and Java 2D graphics. I wanted to start off by creating a simple 2D world game client that has a basic 4 directional moving sprite in a tiled world. But right at the start I’ve run into a simpleton problem and cannot figure out where I fucked it up.

I’m having trouble constructing an ImageIcon. From reading a few tutorials it seems to be done like such:

ImageIcon spriteImage = new ImageIcon(this.getClass().getResource("./path/to/image/sprite.png"));

Then constructing a new Image object using spriteImage.getImage().

It is throwing a null pointer exception implying it cannot find the image file, which I can’t understand as to why. I’ve moved it through directories and tried a number of iterations of debugging but cannot figure it out. I was wondering if anyone could give me assistance and bare with my ignorance.

I’ve attached the small amount of source code that I actually have.
